abstracts.cdata!:
The Livestock Development Project is a
            livestock credit operation in selected areas. Its purpose is
            to increase the production of beef, mutton and wool for
            domestic consumption, as well as for export. Funds from the
            proposed loan and the Government's contribution would
            be lent to farmers for pasture establishment and
            improvement, construction of silos, purchases of
            agricultural machinery, fencing and watering facilities and,
            in some areas, for the purchase of breeding cattle. About
            1,800 farms covering an area of about half a million
            hectares would benefit from lending under the project.
